intro: Hedyosmos, commonly known as the "beautiful flower," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. The plants are characterized by their showy, often pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters. They typically have palmately lobed leaves and produce capsules as fruits. Hedyosmos species are often cultivated for their ornamental value and are also used in traditional medicine.
